metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32066 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Ruby through 2.6.7, 2.7.x through 2.7.3, and 3.xthrough 3.0.1. Net::IMAP does not raise an exception when StartTLS failswith an an unknown response, which might allow man-in-the-middle attackersto bypass the TLS protections by leveraging a network position between theclient and the registry to block the StartTLS command, aka a "StartTLSstripping attack."

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ruby2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
